Data Structures | Macros | Enumerations | Functions
Security Functionality
mcu » apollo330P

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides comprehensive security functions for Apollo5 devices, including device lifecycle management, secure boot operations, cryptographic key management, and hardware security features. It enables secure applications requiring device authentication, data protection, and tamper resistance capabilities.

Key Features

  1. Device Lifecycle: Query and manage device lifecycle state (LCS).
  2. Key Management: Set and manage security keys for device protection.
  3. Lock Status: Query and control lock status for secure memory regions.
  4. Secure Bootloader: Support for secure bootloader exit and image validation.
  5. CRC32: Hardware-accelerated CRC32 calculation for data integrity.

Functionality

  • Retrieve device security information and lifecycle state
  • Set and manage security keys
  • Query and control lock status for secure regions
  • Support secure bootloader operations
  • Perform hardware CRC32 calculations

Usage

  1. Retrieve security info using am_hal_security_get_info()
  2. Set security keys with am_hal_security_set_key()
  3. Query lock status and manage device security
  4. Use CRC32 for data integrity checks

Configuration

  • Key Types: Configure key types and storage
  • Lock Types: Set up lock status for secure regions
  • Bootloader: Configure secure bootloader options

Function Documentation

◆ am_hal_bootloader_exit()

uint32_t am_hal_bootloader_exit ( uint32_t * pImage,
bool bEnableDebuggerOnExit )

Hardcoded function - to Run supplied main program.

Helper function to Perform exit operations for a secondary bootloader.

Parameters
r0= vtor - address of the vector table
Returns
Returns None
Parameters
pImage- The address of the image to give control to This function does the necessary security operations while exiting from a a secondary bootloader program. If still open, it locks the infoc key region, as well as further updates to the flash protection register. It also checks if it needs to halt to honor a debugger request. If an image address is specified, control is transferred to the same on exit.
Returns
Returns AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS on success, if no image address specified If an image address is provided, a successful execution results in transfer to the image - and this function does not return.

◆ am_hal_crc32()

uint32_t am_hal_crc32 ( uint32_t startAddr,
uint32_t sizeBytes,
uint32_t * pCrc )

Compute CRC32 for a specified payload.

Parameters
ui32StartAddr- The start address of the payload.
ui32SizeBytes- The length of payload in bytes.
pui32Crc- Pointer to variable to return the computed CRC.

This function uses the hardware engine to compute CRC32 on an arbitrary data payload. The payload can reside in any contiguous memory including external memory.

Returns
Returns AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS on success

◆ am_hal_security_get_info()

uint32_t am_hal_security_get_info ( am_hal_security_info_t * pSecInfo)

Get Device Security Info.

Parameters
pSecInfo- Pointer to structure for returned security info

This will retrieve the security information for the device

Returns
Returns AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS on success
Note
IMPORTANT - This function requires access to INFO0 and/or INFO1 data. Therefore, if either INFO0 or INFO1 is in OTP, OTP must be powered up prior to calling this function. For more information, see the description for am_hal_info0_read().

◆ am_hal_security_get_lock_status()

uint32_t am_hal_security_get_lock_status ( am_hal_security_locktype_t lockType,
bool * pbUnlockStatus )

Get the current status of the specified lock.

Parameters
lockType- The lock type to be operated upon
pbUnlockStatus- Pointer to return variable with lock status

This will get the lock status for specified lock - true implies unlocked Note that except for customer lock, other locks are self-locking on status read

Returns
Returns AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS on success

◆ am_hal_security_get_socid()

uint32_t am_hal_security_get_socid ( am_hal_security_socid_t * pSocId)

◆ am_hal_security_set_key()

uint32_t am_hal_security_set_key ( am_hal_security_locktype_t lockType,
am_hal_security_128bkey_t * pKey )

Set the key for specified lock.

Parameters
lockType- The lock type to be operated upon
pKey- Pointer to 128b key value

This will program the lock registers for the specified lock and key

Returns
Returns AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS on success
